page.title: 13SOUTH STONEHAM 1
page.content: Most of this area is covered by a large council housing estate,the Leaside Way area.Another area is taken up by 1920s suburban parts of Swaythling.To the north,outside the city boundary,there are playing fields used by sports clubs and schools. (Transport) The M27 motorway passes through the area and Junction 5 is in a corner.A link road is planned to pass through the area to join Portswood and Swaythling to the M27,being part of the A335.There is also a small part of the railway to London.There is a low railway bridge (known as the Black Arch)over the A27 (A335).It is a bottleneck and accident blackspot.Bassett Green Road is a main road(A27). Two city bus routes end here,and county buses go up Stoneham Lane.
